questions.question: What is the purpose of a counter in loops?
options: Repeat a block of code until false

options: Repeat a block of code until the condition is false

options: Iterate over a multi-dimensional array or object
Iterate over a set of instructions

questions.question: Which operator is used to increase the value of the counter variable by 1 in a for loop?

options: Loop skips to the next iteration

questions.question: What is the purpose of the for...of loop in JavaScript?
options: To loop over iterable objects and access their values directly
To loop over properties of objects
To skip the current iteration and move to the next one
To terminate the loop and exit

options: It directly accesses the values of elements in the collection
It provides access to both index and value
It can lead to unexpected results and does not honor the order of elements
It terminates the loop and exits

questions.question: What does the break statement do in a loop?
options: Skips the current iteration and moves to the next one
Increments the counter in the loop
Mutates the condition of the loop

for...of gives access to both index and value, while for...in only gives access to values
for...of accesses values directly, while for...in accesses properties
for...of allows looping over properties, while for...in allows looping over values

questions.question: Which type of objects are suitable for iteration using the for...of loop?
options: Iterable objects like arrays, strings, maps, sets, etc.

It is the same as for-of loop

for...of is used for arrays, for..in for objects
